bibl.title: Callimachus in Context. From Plato to the Augustan Poets.
bibl.note: Introduction. - 1. Literary quarrels. - 2. Performing the text. - 3. Changing places. - 4. In my end is my beginning. - Conclusions. - Appendix: The Aetia.
bibl.seg: Benjamin Acosta-Hughes & Susan Stephens, Callimachus in Context. From Plato to the Augustan Poets.
Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 2012, 8°, xvi-328 pp., 4 cartes. ISBN 978-1-107-00857-1. £62.
Introduction. - 1. Literary quarrels. - 2. Performing the text. - 3. Changing places. - 4. In my end is my beginning. - Conclusions. - Appendix: The Aetia.

C.R. par Jane L. Lightfood, JHS 133 (2013) pp. 147-157 [concerne aussi: Annette Harder, Callimachus, Aetia. Introduction, Text, Translation and Commentary (Oxford, 2012)]. - Evina Sistakou, CR N.S., 64 (2014) pp. 83-85. - Ivana Petrovic, AJP 136 (2015) pp. 365-368.
